element.name: That Nagging Cache by Windsockers, Unknown Cache (4.5/1)

long-description.p:
In order to find the cache you must solve this puzzle
Be prepared to spend some time hunting the location
As I won't be confirming the correct coordinates for you
If at first you don't succeed try try try again

element.additional-waypoints:
FLZMFQ - Final Location
N/S __ 째 __ . ___ W/E ___ 째 __ . ___
element.encoded-hints:
You can't be serious and think I'd help
but A scissors could be useful
and maybe a magnifying glass
[:D]
[:D]
[:D]

ul.li:
2010-03-13T20:00:00Z : Found it by Frezeluberz
As I log this I see that no one has found it since 2008. Wish I'd come to get it last year. That would have made this one and Las Vegas in the Hills the only caches with us as the visitors in 2009 ... damn. I solved this a long time ago but never seemed to take the time off the motorway to grab it. Very glad previous people had made the effort to try and find this and highlighted that there were more than one solution. I heard Fjon's post and skipped the first two I found. A little while later ... maybe three days the penny dropped and back I came to see if I was right and what d'ye' know ... bingo ;)
Eventually the name got to me and we made the detour. Arrived close to GZ in the dark. Out of the car, round to the boot and out come the ... um ... torches? Where are the torches? Damn - left them at home - got the car serviced earlier in the week and forgot to put the geocaching pruck back in the boot :( Never mind, we'll give it a go in the dark ... by phone light. Got to GZ and we were happy about the location ... seemed a valid spot to hide a cache. Started looking ... and looking ... and looking, but seriously, the light on our phones are pants. Caved in and phoned Mr Windsockers for a tip. We weren't far off the cache it would seem. Told him what we were near, and what object we were beside and he tried his best to describe what we're meant to be looking for ... in the dark. Got off the phone and the hunt began again. After quite some considerable time we did manage to find the little critter. Haven't seen a cache container quite like this one. Enjoyed the puzzle and glad we made the detour to finally put this one to bed. No more Nagging Cache for me. TFTC.

2008-12-05T20:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by Windsockers
Cache checked all in order

2008-11-12T20:00:00Z : Didn't find it by theswerve
While in Balbriggan the co-ords i had were closeby..needless to say they led to the wrong place..at least i know it`s not there!

2008-10-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
This cache took me many months, so it's very satisfying to finally find it. Third time's a charm!

2008-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Well I knew where *not* to look from the previous logs on this cache, so didn't even bother with the obvious co-ords. After a little poking around I found the nasty little container. Nice to be able to strike this off my list!

wpt.desc: That Nagging Cache by Windsockers, Unknown Cache (4.5/1)

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text:
As I log this I see that no one has found it since 2008. Wish I'd come to get it last year. That would have made this one and Las Vegas in the Hills the only caches with us as the visitors in 2009 ... damn. I solved this a long time ago but never seemed to take the time off the motorway to grab it. Very glad previous people had made the effort to try and find this and highlighted that there were more than one solution. I heard Fjon's post and skipped the first two I found. A little while later ... maybe three days the penny dropped and back I came to see if I was right and what d'ye' know ... bingo ;)
Eventually the name got to me and we made the detour. Arrived close to GZ in the dark. Out of the car, round to the boot and out come the ... um ... torches? Where are the torches? Damn - left them at home - got the car serviced earlier in the week and forgot to put the geocaching pruck back in the boot :( Never mind, we'll give it a go in the dark ... by phone light. Got to GZ and we were happy about the location ... seemed a valid spot to hide a cache. Started looking ... and looking ... and looking, but seriously, the light on our phones are pants. Caved in and phoned Mr Windsockers for a tip. We weren't far off the cache it would seem. Told him what we were near, and what object we were beside and he tried his best to describe what we're meant to be looking for ... in the dark. Got off the phone and the hunt began again. After quite some considerable time we did manage to find the little critter. Haven't seen a cache container quite like this one. Enjoyed the puzzle and glad we made the detour to finally put this one to bed. No more Nagging Cache for me. TFTC.
While in Balbriggan the co-ords i had were closeby..needless to say they led to the wrong place..at least i know it`s not there!
This cache took me many months, so it's very satisfying to finally find it. Third time's a charm!

Well I knew where *not* to look from the previous logs on this cache, so didn't even bother with the obvious co-ords. After a little poking around I found the nasty little container. Nice to be able to strike this off my list!
